UX design

My work experience at Watb Creative

For me work experience at WATB was a turning point of trasforming my design practise of displaying information. Rather than just showing information in an atractive way, I've learnd how to present it in an efficient & concise way. I endeavor toward work that drives action and engage customer to generate conversion on the digital product.

Human-computer interaction

An example of one of the prototypes I've built during my work at WATB

Reframing a running experience required various discovery and conception phases, detailed research, different user experience solutions and countless scribbled wireframes. A first thought of processing into a gamification direction was discarded soon â€“ a minimalistic, straight forward approach made it definite.

For example all basic elements needed for starting a run can be found on the startscreen of the app. By tapping the run button the next workout starts immediately which spares users to navigate through run related settings.

Agency WATB
Client Sav Group

Customer Experience Design

Constantly analyzing the customers jurney we've learnd how to improve customer experience

As a part of Watb team I've worked a lot with a team on user jurney and interaction processes. Here you could see an examples of a high fidelity prototype of an website of a property development and investment company Sav Group. I've started out wireframing the basic feature and grid strucure of the home page. After this, I've started to create mid-fidelity templates, importing real data and graphic elements to make the design more realistic.

CTA section on the website built by Watb: Shippo
